instruction: What kinds of spectrum was used in the study for the quality control of herbal medicines and functional foods?
Output: In the study, near infrared reflection spectra (NIRS) of Flos Chrysanthemi samples were used for the quality control of herbal medicines and functional foods.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the selection of quality markers from Flos Chrysanthemi samples?
Output: RMSECV was used for the selection of quality markers from Flos Chrysanthemi samples.

instruction: What metric was chosen to compare the relationship between Q-marker contents and anti-inflammation activity?
Output: The metric chosen to compare the relationship between Q-marker contents and anti-inflammation activity was the coefficient of determination (R).

instruction: What machine learning approaches were used to compare the relationship between quality marker contents and anti-inflammation activity evaluating the spectrum-activity relationship in Flos Chrysanthemi samples?
Output: The machine learning approaches used to compare the relationship between quality marker contents and anti-inflammation activity evaluating the spectrum-activity relationship in Flos Chrysanthemi samples were partial least squares regression (PLSR) and back-propagation neural network (BP-ANN).

instruction: Can the integrated NIRS and bioactive strategy be used for fast quality management in Flos Chrysanthemi and other botanical food quality control, based on the past study's evaluation of the spectrum-activity relationship in Flos Chrysanthemi samples using near infrared reflection spectra (NIRS) and corresponding anti-inflammation activities?
Output: Yes. The past study suggests that the integrated NIRS and bioactive strategy can be used for fast quality management in Flos Chrysanthemi and other botanical food quality control. The study collected near infrared reflection spectra (NIRS) of Flos Chrysanthemi samples and used corresponding anti-inflammation activities to evaluate the spectrum-activity relationship. The study also developed calibration models and used machine learning approaches to analyze the relationship between quality markers and anti-inflammation activity. The results indicated that the integrated NIRS and bioactive strategy was suitable for fast quality management in Flos Chrysanthemi and could be applied to other botanical food quality control.
